title: Insight into Lipidology
content: Research into lipidology has provided insight into patient cases and thinking about lipids. This research has spanned across various fields including clinical, nutrition, genetics, and drug research.

title: Understanding Dyslipidemia and Interventions
content: Being more informed about dyslipidemia and the interventions used can reduce the risk of atherosclerotic disease, cerebrovascular disease, and peripheral vascular disease.

title: Discussion on Atherosclerosis
content: The pathogenesis of atherosclerosis and how early it begins is a topic of discussion. The role of chronic inflammation in atherosclerosis is also considered.

title: Lipidology and Heart Disease
content: The 'battle' between LDL particle size and particle number, the use of statins, and why niacin may have been unjustly dismissed as a therapeutic option are all topics of interest in the study of heart disease.

title: HDL Paradox and Heart Disease Risk
content: The HDL paradox is a phenomenon where drugs that raise HDL-C seem to elevate (or have little impact on) heart disease risk.

title: Mendelian Randomization and PCSK9 Inhibitors
content: Mendelian randomization, natureâ€™s randomized trial, and how PCSK9 inhibitors work and why they may be underutilized are also topics of discussion.

title: Preventing Cardiovascular Disease
content: The latest in diagnostic imaging, blood pressure, metabolic health, and more.

title: Pros and Cons of GLP-1 Weight Loss Drugs and Metformin
content: Discussion on the pros and cons of GLP-1 weight loss drugs and metformin as a geroprotective agent.

title: Understanding Atherosclerosis
content: Atherosclerosis is a multifocal, smoldering, immunoinflammatory disease of medium-sized and large arteries fuelled by lipids. The pathogenesis of atherosclerosis, the different stages of atherosclerosis, and when heart disease begins are discussed.

title: Risk Factors for Heart Disease
content: Discussion on the biggest risk factor for heart disease and the difference between cholesterol, lipoproteins, LDL-C, LDL-P, and ApoB.

title: Role of LDL in Heart Disease
content: Discussion on whether LDL causes heart disease, taking into account time, and magnitude, of exposure of LDL concentrations.

title: Use of Statins
content: Discussion on the use of statins, their adverse effects, and their role in reducing events, possibly by improving endothelial health and/or reducing inflammation.

title: Role of Inflammation in Atherosclerosis
content: Discussion on the role of chronic inflammation in atherosclerosis and the potential benefits of reducing inflammation.

title: Use of Niacin in Treatment
content: Discussion on why niacin may have been unjustly dismissed as a therapeutic option and its effects on HDL.

title: Understanding Lp(a)
content: Discussion on Lp(a) and how statins and PCSK9 inhibitors can affect LDL-C and LDL-P.
